original: HANSON, Axel Oscar Carl Theobald, Civilingenjör, Göteborg, f Gbg 19/6 98 av sjökapt 0 B H o Thelma Bengtsson, gm Kerstin Olson. Realex 13, verkmäst.ex v CTI 17, kom-plett.kurs CTI 18, CTH (mek) 22; behörigh s spec.lär i svetstekn v lärlings- o yrkessk. Konstr o bitr verkst.ing v El Svetsnings AB 1 Gbg 22—23, avd.chef där sed. 23. Ag fastigh Carl-Johansgat 66 o 68 o Oxhagsgat 64 Gbg. Sakk i beredn.utsk f svetsundervisn v Gbgs lärl- o yrkessk; Ind.luftsk.led; led av IVA:s svetskomm :s arb.utsk o ds kté f säkerh.före-skr, sekr i ds kté f undervisn o utbildn. Sekr i Svetstekn frns Gbgsavd, styr.led i Gbgs ind.-luftsk.frn o i Gbgs reklamfrn, styr.suppl AB Elektrosvets. Resor: Danm, Tyskl, Holl, Engl fore 20, USA 21, Tyskl 21, 31, 34, 35, 37, 38, 41, Engl 29, Danm 34, 36, 38, 41, Norge 38, 39. Av trycket: Lärokurs i elsvetsn tills m E Helin, fi svetstekn upps i dags- o fackpress, red f facktidskr »Svetsaren» sed. 36. IVA:s 20-årsjub.jetong, pistolskyttegm, duellbrm, hv-åldersm; Odd Fellow, Tekn Samf, GKSS, Svetstekn frn, Gbgs reklamfrn mfl. Hobbies: Segling, Skytte.
translated: HANSON, Axel Oscar Carl Theobald, Civil Engineer, Gothenburg, b. Gothenburg 19/6 1898, as the son of ship captain B H and Thelma Bengtsson, m. Kerstin Olson. Graduated from Realex School at age 13, workshop foreman at CTI 17, completed course at CTI 18, studied mechanical engineering at CTH in 1922; qualified as a specialist teacher in welding technology at apprentice and vocational schools. Construction and assistant workshop engineer at El Svetsnings AB in Gothenburg from 1922 to 1923, department manager since 1923. Owns properties at Carl-Johansgatan 66 and 68, and Oxhagsgatan 64 in Gothenburg. Expert in the preparatory committee for welding education at Gothenburg apprentice and vocational school; member of the Industrial Air School board; member of the welding committee and the safety regulations committee of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (IVA), secretary in the committee for education and training. Secretary at the Gothenburg division of the Swedish Institute of Welding Technology, board member of the Gothenburg Industrial Air School and the Gothenburg Advertising Association, board substitute at AB Elektrosvets. Travelled to Denmark, Germany, the Netherlands, and England before 1920, went to the USA in 1921, Germany in 1921, 1931, 1934, 1935, 1937, 1938, 1941, England in 1929, Denmark in 1934, 1936, 1938, 1941, Norway in 1938, 1939. Published textbooks on electric welding with E Helin, wrote various articles on welding technology in daily and trade press, editor of the trade journal "Svetsaren" since 1936. Received a medal for the 20th anniversary of IVA, proficient in pistol shooting, dueling, and elder age sports; member of the Odd Fellow, Technical Society, GKSS, Swedish Institute of Welding Technology, Gothenburg Advertising Association, among others. Hobbies: Sailing, Shooting.

hasOccupation.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (IVA)
